product.title: vBSEO :: Sitemap Generator
product.description: Generate a Google & Yahoo Sitemap for your Forums

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Set the addon module names here, one name per line. The modules files are located in vbseo_sitemap/addons/ folder.
Select "Yes" to include your member profile album pages in your sitemaps (album.php).
Select "Yes" to include your show archive pages in your sitemaps (archive/index.php).
Select "Yes" to include your blog pages in your sitemaps (blog.php).
Use this option to let sitemap generator "sleep" for specified number of seconds after each sitemap is generated. Use it if you experience forums slowdown during sitemap generation.
Delay Execution After Each Sitemap File

Enter an email address where a summary report of the sitemap generation will be sent each time it is created.

NOTE: Leave this field blank to disable email notifications.

Specify the forum ID for all forums that you do NOT wish to be included in your sitemaps. Note that private forums are NOT included within the default generated sitemaps.

NOTE: Separate multiple forum IDs with spaces.
Select "Yes" to include your forum display pages in your sitemaps (forumdisplay.php).
Indicate how frequently your album pages will be updated.
Indicate how frequently your blog entry pages will be updated.
Indicate how frequently your forum display pages will be updated.
Indicate how frequently your social group picture pages will be updated.
Indicate how frequently your social group pages will be updated.

Indicate how frequently your member profile pages will be updated.

NOTE: Member Profile pages are only updated when users update their profile information. The default of 'Monthly' or 'Yearly' is recommended.
Indicate how frequently your poll results pages will be updated.

Indicate how frequently your show post pages will be updated.

NOTE: Show post pages are only updated when the post is edited. The default of 'Never' or 'Yearly' is recommended to avoid unnecessary recrawling of your pages.
Indicate how frequently your tag pages will be updated.

Select 'Yes' to activate automated page update frequency calculations for each show thread page.

NOTE: Frequency is calculated based on the last modification time.
Smart Frequency for Show Thread Pages

Indicate how frequently your show thread pages will be updated.

NOTE: This default is only applied if you do NOT used the "Smart Frequency for Show Thread Pages" feature (see below).
Select "Yes" to include your social group pages in your sitemaps (group.php).

Select "Yes" to include your social group picture pages in your sitemaps (group.php).

NOTE: This content is a duplicate of the Member Profile Album Pages, as such, we suggest *not* submitting it as part of your sitemap. Alternatively, you may want to submit this content and set the Include Member Profile Album Pages option to 'OFF'.

Specify the maximum number of URLs to be included in each sitemap file.

NOTE: Google allows no more than 50,000 URLs per file.
Select "Yes" to include your member profile pages in your sitemaps (member.php).

While vBSEO will automatically 301-redirect old (dynamic) URLs to the newly formatted static URLs, some users may opt to include the old URLs in the sitemap to ensure Google finds the redirect headers for each page. Include this option until you note that most old URLs have been purged from Google.
If you have vBSEO, include old urls?

Select "Yes" to automatically notify Search Engines (Google, Yahoo, Ask, Moreover) of your updated sitemap each time it is generated.

NOTE: Notification is sent via a HTTP request to the SE servers.
Select "Yes" to include your poll results pages in your sitemaps (poll.php).
The priority is a value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates the priority that should be given to the crawling and indexing of the page relative to other pages.

Select "Yes" to activate smart priority setting for show thread pages. Priority will be automatically calculated for each thread based on (a) views, (b) replies, (c) rating, and (d) number of Linkbacks.

NOTE: If your forum does not have Linkback capability, the smart priority will be calculated based on elements (a) to (c) above.
Smart Priority for Show Thread Pages

Priority value between 0.0 and 1.0 (see above).

NOTE: This default is only applied if you do NOT used the "Smart Priority for Show Thread Pages" feature (see below).
This values is used as your password when logging into your reports area: "vbroot/vbseo_sitemap/"
Select "Yes" to include your show post pages in your sitemaps (showpost.php).
Select "Yes" to include your show thread pages in your sitemaps (showthread.php).
Select "Yes" to include your tag pages in your sitemaps (tags.php).

By default the vBSEO Sitemap files will be located in your forum root. Use this field to specify a different location, for example, your site root: http://www.yourdomain.com

NOTE: You must edit the .htaccess file of the folder in which you want to locate your sitemap files. More information here. Leave this setting empty to use default vB url.

Select "Yes" to automatically generate a text format sitemap with 1 URL per line.

This text sitemap must be manually submitted to Yahoo at http://submit.search.yahoo.com/free/request/.

The sitemap generator is fully compatible with the vBSEO search engine optimization plugin.

Select "Yes" if you have vBSEO installed - as a result your sitemap will contain vBSEO's static CRUs (Content Relevant URLs).

Example:
http://www.vbseo.com/f84/my-personal-success-story-605/. For more information, visit http://www.vbseo.com
